# Issue Templates

This directory contains GitHub issue templates for the Guardyn project. These templates help maintain consistency and ensure all necessary information is provided when reporting issues.

## Available Templates

### üêõ Bug Report

Use this template to report bugs or unexpected behavior in any component of Guardyn.

**Best for:**

- Application crashes or errors
- Unexpected behavior
- Performance issues
- Broken functionality

### ‚ú® Feature Request

Use this template to suggest new features or enhancements to existing functionality.

**Best for:**

- New capabilities you'd like to see
- Improvements to existing features
- User experience enhancements
- Integration requests

### üìö Documentation Issue

Use this template to report problems with documentation or suggest improvements.

**Best for:**

- Missing or incomplete documentation
- Outdated information
- Unclear explanations
- Broken links or typos
- Missing code examples

### üß™ Testing Issue

Use this template for issues related to tests, test infrastructure, or CI/CD pipelines.

**Best for:**

- Failing tests
- Flaky tests
- CI/CD pipeline issues
- Test coverage concerns
- Missing test cases

### üèóÔ∏è Infrastructure/DevOps Issue

Use this template for infrastructure, deployment, or DevOps-related problems.

**Best for:**

- Kubernetes deployment issues
- Service startup problems
- Resource constraints
- Networking issues
- Build system problems
- Secret management issues

### ü§ù Contribution Question

Use this template if you have questions about contributing to Guardyn.

**Best for:**

- How to get started contributing
- Clarification on contribution guidelines
- Questions about development setup
- Asking about good first issues

## Special Cases

### üîí Security Vulnerabilities

**DO NOT** use GitHub issues for security vulnerabilities!

Instead, please email: **<security@guardyn.app>**

See our [Security Policy](../../SECURITY.md) for details on responsible disclosure.

### üí¨ General Questions

For general questions not covered by the templates above:

- Start a [GitHub Discussion](https://github.com/guardyn/guardyn/discussions)
- Email: <hello@guardyn.app>
- Check the [Documentation](../../docs/)

## Before Creating an Issue

1. **Search existing issues** - Your issue may already be reported
2. **Check documentation** - Answer might be in [docs/](../../docs/)
3. **Choose the right template** - Use the most specific template for your case
4. **Fill out all sections** - More information helps us help you faster
5. **Remove sensitive data** - Never include passwords, API keys, or private information

## Template Guidelines

When filling out a template:

- **Be specific** - Vague descriptions are hard to act on
- **Provide context** - Include relevant environment details
- **Show, don't just tell** - Include logs, screenshots, or code samples
- **Remove placeholders** - Delete unused sections or placeholder text
- **Use English** - All issues must be in English (per project policy)

## For Maintainers

### Labeling Issues

After an issue is created, maintainers should:

1. Review and validate the issue
2. Add appropriate labels (beyond `needs-triage`)
3. Set milestones if applicable
4. Assign to relevant team members
5. Link to related issues or PRs

### Closing Issues

Issues can be closed when:

- The problem is resolved (include fix details)
- The issue is a duplicate (link to original)
- The issue is not actionable or out of scope
- The reporter is unresponsive after 30 days

Always provide a reason when closing an issue.

## Improving Templates

Found a way to improve these templates? Please:

1. Open a Documentation Issue
2. Describe the improvement
3. Submit a PR with changes

---

**Questions about templates?** Open a [Contribution Question](.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/contribution.md) issue!
